column1: back of a length and angling in towards middle stump, Amla, having shuffled across off stump, neatly clips it away through square leg
back of a length and angling across the left-handed de Kock. He has a waft at it with no feet and squirts an inside edge onto the pad
on a good length and slanting away in the channel outside off, some seam movement for Mashrafe too. De Kock nibbles at it again, this time he watches the ball beat the outside edge
back of a length on off, tip-and-run single in front of cover. Good urgency from SA' openers
floated very full and wider outside off, 127ks. Just inside the tramline. Left alone
back of a length and seams back in on off, Amla hastily jabs his bat down in line and keeps it out
starts off with a wayward short, wide offering, and gets away. De Kock slashes it straight to backward point
full and straight, tighter from Taskin, not full enough to drive. Bunted to short midwicket
overpitched and outside off, de Kock leans into a good-looking drive and finds cover
short and slanting away outside off, de Kock chops it away behind point for one
Amla gets on top of this shortish ball outside off and cracks it straight to backward point
Amla, standing on leg stump, ventures across off and gets right behind this full ball on a fourth-stump line
floated full on the pads, de Kock merrily glances it away to long leg

shot, Amla! This deserved to be punished. Floaty half-volley outside off, Amla leans into the drive and places it in the gap at extra cover. Lovely flow of the arms from Amla. That's the first boundary of the day
back of a length and outside off, crisply punched to that fielder
back of a length and outside off, Amla employs the latest of late cuts, running the ball down to deep third man
pitched up and rolling through outside off, 125ks, ignored
floated full and wider outside off, Amla does not go after it
pitched up and outside off, de Kock caresses it off the front foot, but Mahmudullah at cover tumbles to his left and intercepts the ball. That should encourage the bowlers
back of a length and angling away outside off, the ball does not come on. De Kock looks to force it away, he winds up chopping it square through the off side
back of a length and outside off, leans back and cuts, but can't beat Nasir at backward point
long half-volley outside off, de Kock stretches forward and simply shows the full face of the bat, easing it through extra cover
shorter and outside off, gets on top of the bounce and glides a single to deep third man
shortish and outside off, Amla stands tall and punches straight to cover
full and angling across off, barely 125ks, left alone. Bounces twice before reaching Mushfiqur
back of a length and angling away outside off, chopped behind to the keeper
hip-high short ball outside off, swatted away square of long leg
full and straight, clipped away to the left of the leg umpire
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Amla uses his wrists and strokes the ball to mid-on
back of a length and width outside off, Amla sizes it up and drills it on the up to backward point
pitched up and outside off, driven through the line to the right of mid-off for one
back of a length and outside off, guided to backward point. Amla sends de Kock back
short and shoved down the leg side, as de Kock pulls and misses, wide called
hip-high short ball outside off, de Kock lays into pull but hits is straight to Shakib at midwicket. These short balls are sitting up on this sluggish surface
back of a length and on middle, tucked down to long leg
now it's Amla turn to tuck a single down to long leg
back of a length and angling away outside off, run down to third man
dug in short on middle, cramps the batsman for room, forced to cover
leg-stump half-volley, whipped away to deep square leg
on a length and outside off, Amla opens the face and slides it down to third man
back of a length on leg stump, de Kock backs away outside leg but does not manufacture enough swinging room. He ends up jabbing it to cover

an appeal for leg-before, not given. Bangladesh choose not to review. Back of a length, slower offcutter, hits the thigh. De Kock crouched as he tried to pull it. He did not spot the change-up, but it seemed to have pitched outside leg
much fuller on middle, de Kock steps away outside leg, this time he manufactures enough swinging room. He lifts it over mid-off, the ball plugs in the deep. The outfield seems sluggish too
dug short and outside off, only 133ks, Amla has all the time in the world to skip back and strongly pull it in the air over square leg
fuller and outside off, guided past slip to third man
shortish on top of off, punched on the up to cover
on a length and outside off, Amla opens the face and secures another single to third man
short on middle, tucked through midwicket
wild short ball down leg, Mushfiq dives full-length to his right to gather the ball. Excellent effort
back of a length and angling across off, de Kock forces it to cover
full and sliding down leg, past Amla's flick, wide
skids in with the arm on middle, Amla pushes it down to long-off
half-tracker outside off, de Kock can only pull it as far as long-on
tossed up on middle, worked away through midwicket
fired on the pads, whipped to midwicket
another non-turner outside off, de Kock presses forward and eases a drive to wide long-on
low-arm slider on middle, played back to Shakib
shorter and outside off, de Kock ventures deep in the crease and slaps it down to long-off
Amla welcomes Nasir into the attack with a boundary.... or not. The ball plugs in the deep. This outfield is ultra slow. Tossed on off, Amla launches it over mid-off. Amla has to settle with three
pushed through on middle, worked away to the leg side
flayed on the up to cover
picked off the pads to deep midwicket
round-arm dart on the leg stump, bunted wide of midwicket. That single brings up the fifty partnership and caps the Powerplay
short and angling across off, flashed to backward point
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up but straight to cover
back of a length and angling away outside off, the ball isn't coming onto the bat, the batsman is early into a pull. He gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
punched on the up to the off-side sweeper
Amla allows this length ball to come onto him, then steers a single to third man
back of a length on off, de Kock forces to mid-off
tossed on the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
starts outside off and spins in, nudged to midwicket off the front foot
full and straight, rolls his wrists and sweeps it wide of deep square leg for a double
turn - of the slow variety - for Shakib, tapped through midwicket
speared short on off, Amla replies with a back-foot punch to long-on
flighted on middle, driven away to midwicket
full and just a shade outside off, Amla hits it on the up but can't get it past cover
full and outside off, Amla stretches forward, opens the face, and drives it smoothly to sweeper cover
clipped off the pads to the right of long leg

not short enough for a pull. This is speared on off stump, De Kock cops a blow on his waist as the ball rolls away behind square on the off side. De Kock is going too hard at the ball on this slow track
full and outside off, run down to third man
back of a length on off, turned to deep square leg with the wrists
tossed up on middle, full, pushed down to long-on
back of a length on off, swatted down to long-on
De Kock uses his feet, Shakib fires it flatter and shorter. Poked into the covers
tucked around the corner for a single
pushed through full on the stumps, driven with ease to long-on
darted on the pads, whipped to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, de Kock firmly punches it in the gap at midwicket. The man in the deep slides to his right and swats the ball back to Taskin, the other chasing fielder
banged in short and outside off, draws a top edge from Amla's pull. Balloons over square leg
back of a length, chopped from off stump to third man
back of a length on off, now de Kock chops it to deep third man
shorter and outside off, 138ks, sticks in the surface. Amla thinks about playing or leaving. In the end, he flaps it to midwicket
short and skidding down the leg side, Amla misses a flick, Mushfiq flies to his left to grab the ball with one hand
back of a length and angling in on off, manipulated with the wrists through square leg
pushed through on off stump, driven down to long-off
flat on middle, de Kock backs away, and cuts from the stumps to cover
clipped off the pads to midwicket
Amla skips down the track, Shakib pulls his length back. He darts it in and hits the pad. But the batsmen cross over for a leg bye
tossed up and outside off, de Kock runs down the track and hammers it to deep midwicket
fuller and faster on middle, played back to the bowler and that's drinks
back of a length and outside off, Amla stands tall and forces a single wide of cover
glanced off the pads to the right of long leg
full on middle, tip-and-run single in front of cover. The strike rotation has been excellent from these two
hip-high back-of-a-length delivery on off, Amla shovel-pulls it to long leg
De Kock stands tall and punches a single to mid-off, where Mahmudullah helps SA's cause by misfielding
good length and outside off, driven with an open face to backward point
floated up on middle, down the track and driven down to long-on
back of a length on middle, backs away outside leg and drives a single to sweeper cover

Yes, it's a W-I-C-K-E-T! After 372 runs and 60.2 overs, Bangladesh finally manage to separate Hashim Amla and Quinton de Kock. Shakib slides it in on middle from over the wicket. De Kock plays around his front pad, misses the full, straight ball, and is trapped in front of middle. That was pretty adjacent. It would have crashed into leg stump
length ball on off, defended
back of a length and darted on top of off, punched back

Bangladesh did not find a breakthrough in the first ODI, they have now struck twice in four balls. Shakib's the man. This is a beautiful delivery: liberally tossed up, drifts in on middle, then breaks away to hit the top of off stump. Faf had stayed leg side of the ball, and missed it. He has a wry smile. Shakib wheels away in celebration
short and outside off, flayed to sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, punched sweetly to sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, cracked straight to backward point

A mix-up between the wickets, but Mahmudullah at mid-on could not collect the ball cleanly. Back of a length on middle, jabbed back down the pitch to mid-on. Mahmudullah swoops in on the ball but does not gather it
back of a length and outside off, punched through the covers
whipped from outside off to midwicket
92ks arm ball from Shakib, hurries AB into a cut. He thickly edges it to the left of first slip, where the fielder was late to react
skids on outside off, chopped to cover
tossed on middle, AB stays leg side of the ball and plays it back to the bowler
speared on off, pushed back to the bowler
length ball on off, driven to cover off the front foot
full and outside off, driven through the line to the right of sweeper cover
Amla shuffles across off and works to midwicket
on a length and outside off, AB aims to drive on the up, instead skews it to mid-on off the inside half
slower bouncer, outside leg, the batsman gets out of the way. Wide
overpitched and outside off, AB crunches it through the covers. That drive raced away to the boundary. First boundary for SA in nearly an hour
dragged short on off stump, AB brings his bottom hand into play, shovelling it away to the midwicket boundary
back of a length and outside off, de Villiers plays early and nearly drags it back onto the stumps
back of a length and outside off, stabbed back to Mashrafe
pushed through on middle, twirled to deep midwicket
straight ball on middle, AB stays leg side of the ball and defends
back of a length on middle, backs away outside leg and slashes it to cover
pitched up and outside off, caressed to deep cover
tossed up on middle, eased down to long-off
looped up on middle, driven down to long-on
short and wide outside off, slashed away square of third man. Bangladesh keep dishing out these loose balls, and SA's batsmen keep punishing them
short and outside off, stands tall and punches to sweeper cover
pitched up and outside off, AB crisply drives it to sweeper cover
back of a length on off, tapped to midwicket
full and angling into leg stump, smartly driven to deep midwicket
slower ball on off, offcutter, guided through point. Amla acknowledges his fifty and looks good for another hundred
back of a length and outside off, punched solidly to sweeper cover
AB steps away outside leg, drives from middle to long-off
round-arm dart on the leg stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
slid in on middle, short, AB stays leg side of the ball and cracks it to sweeper cover again
very full and outside off, drilled through cover-point
fractionally short on the leg stump, AB reads the length early. He rocks back and hammers a pull to the midwicket boundary
pushed through on the pads, whipped to deep midwicket
now it's AB's turn to whip through midwicket
back of a length and outside off, Amla goes on the back foot and slaps to cover
full, non-turning ball on middle, bunted to long-on
tossed on off, played back to the bowler off the front foot
AB jumps outside leg, puts Nasir off. Then slinks back in, takes a full-toss from middle and slog-sweeps it to the midwicket boundary
back of a length at leg stump, tapped on the up to midwicket
good length, 136 kph, angled in at off stump. Nicely behind the line to dead bat this to point
back of a length on the pads, nudged to deep square leg
back of a length in the corridor, skids on and thuds the bat as he looks to drop it into the off side

short and in the corridor. He steps out and makes room to slap this past extra cover. Wasn't off the middle of the bat, but sweeper runs a long way to his right...and then shies away from the dive. Tamim Iqbal. Sticks out a lazy boot and it's toughing the rope on one side, the ball with the other
oh shot. Back of a length, climbing at leg stump, but he's down the track again and whips this over midwicket
tossed up at leg stump, punched to long-on
floated up at leg stump, driven to long-on
good length at leg stump, tapped to midwicket from the crease
good length outside off, not to the pitch as he shapes to drive. Goes on with the shot and drives it aerially, wide of  both extra cover and long-off
length at off stump, driven back at the bowler
length at middle stump, pushed down to long-on
short ball in the corridor, quickly on top of the bounce for a controlled pull to deep square
attempted bouncer, too short and too far outside off stump, AB can't reach it
phew. Five away from fifty now. Length ball outside off stump, steps out and slaps it wide of mid-off, even as it's climbing
full at leg stump, flicked straight to deep square
good length in the corridor, caressed on the up to sweeper cover
oh dear. Yorker just outside off, very well bowled. Batsman jams it back at the bowler, who picks up with one hand and shies at the stumps. The keeper can't collect it and third man has to clean up
short ball, in at the ribs. Tall in the crease as he whips this to deep square
well...that goes horribly wrong. Pitches about eight yards away from AB, and then sits up for him to slap it to the extra cover boundary for his fifty
short ball at middle stump this time, can't get it past fine leg with the whip
too easy. Short and wide again, hammered to sweeper's right again
length at middle stump, goes deep in the crease and nudges it through square leg
back of a length at off stump, sliced to sweeper cover
tossed up at off stump, controlled drive to long-off
good length at middle stump, defended to midwicket
good length at middle stump, flicked to long-on
full at middle stump, pushed back down the pitch
back of a length at leg stump, shovelled aerially to long-on
full at leg stump, pushed through flat. Flicked straight to midwicket
yorker at middle stump, makes room and just manages to squeeze this out to long-off
good length at leg stump, flicked past midwicket
back of a length outside off, chopped wide of backward point who tumbles to his right and gets a hand
back of a length, fired down leg side, past the attempted flick
oh well adjusted. This one slides straight from a length outside off, he stretches forward and opens the face at the last moment to guide it through where slip would've been
full at off stump, driven firmly to long-off
good length at leg stump, whipped to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, pushed back at the bowler
full at middle stump, plonks the front leg across and flicks to deep midwicket
good length at leg stump, check-drive to long-on
whack. He backs away early to make room, but sees a full toss floated up at leg stump. Quickly gets down and under it and sends it flying into the bar at the deep midwicket boundary with a slog sweep
full at leg stump, flicked to midwicket
backs away again, at this length ball on middle, looks to drive over extra cover, but gets a thick inside edge to long-on
length at of stump, punched to long-off
back of a length outside off stump, deep in the crease to slice this between short third and cover point
tossed up at off stump, driven to long-off's left
good length outside off, big stride forward to flick this wide of midwicket
good length at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
tossed up at leg stump, driven to long-on
back of a length at leg stump, punched to deep midwicket
good length, some tail back in, aimed for off stump. Poked in front of extra cover with soft hands
overpitched at leg stump, clipped with control to deep midwicket
good length at off stump, a loose shot. No feet. Drags it aerially, wide of mid-on
full and just outside off, late on the drive. Toe-ends it to mid-off
lovely. He's been troubled a bit with the inswinging ball, but he recovers and uses his strength - his balance - to drill this full ball wide of mid-off
good length at off stump, quickly shimmies and gets the reverse sweep out. Dabs it past short third man
good length at middle stump, tapped on the up to long-on
good length, leg stump. Driven to long-on
good length, angled down leg side. De Villiers lets it go...and it isn't called a wide
full at leg stump, driven to long-on
good length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket on the up
back of a length outside off stump, gets the front leg out the way and punches it straight to mid-on. Was looking to whip it, but that hurried on
yorker tails in at leg stump, he manages to squeeze it between the legs to short fine leg
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to sweeper cover on the up
good length, slight shape in. Tucked away with a closed face to deep square
yorker in the corridor, jams it into the pitch perfect timing to get it over the bowler and past mid-off. It races away, but the fielder does well to parry it back in

a wicket at last for Bangladesh. Rubel had troubled Amla in this little spell so far. This one is back of a length, slight dip inwards before straightening. Angled bat from Amla who is trying to dab it to third man. A nice, loud edge on it
good length, fired down leg side. Quick hands as AB flicks. Off the inside edge and dribbles past short fine
tossed up outside off stump, driven down to long-on
back of a length at off stump, punched off the back foot to sweeper
good length at middle stump, pushed to deep midwicket
good length at off stump, steps out and gets a leading edge to point
good length at off stump, pushed back down the pitch
good length, shaping in at off stump, driven on the up to long-off
back of a length, dips outwards from Duminy. Squares him up and takes a big outside edge that runs down to third man
full and swinging in at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's left

oh geez. Forgive my curiosity. This guy can hit any shot. Similar ball to the last one, full and swinging into the pads. But this time he gets well in front of the body and instead of flicking, drives it through the exact spot to deep midwicket's left
class. Full at leg stump, driven past the non-striker. Mid-on dives and parries it to long-off
a hundred on return. Back of a length at leg stump, easily on top of this to tuck it to deep square
good length at leg stump, pushed down the pitch off the front foot
poor fielding. Short at off stump, backs away and slaps it straight to cover point who looks afraid as it approches him. Gingerly pokes a reverse cup out and lets it through
length at off stump, makes room and punches to long-off
full at off stump, driven straight to extra cover
full and angled in at leg stump, poked through square leg
full at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
full and swinging in at leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
back of a length at leg stump, whipped to square leg

top edge falls between fine leg and deep square. Short ball outside off, gets behind it and the bottom hand comes off the bat s he plays the hook. He's not in control. The fielders didn't get close...but Mortaza yells at them. My colleague says, in Bengali, he's sent an impolite enquiry about the fielder's competence
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
full and in at the pads, flicked to fine leg
short one at middle stump, deep in the crease to pull this to deep square
offcutter, back of a length at off stump. Waits for it to come on and guides it to third man
short one at off stump, pull shot right off the middle, straight to deep square
good length at off stump, beaten by the offcutter. Looks to drive through the off side, gets it back down the pitch...and Mortaza misfields
slower ball, dug in short at middle stump. He backs away and looks to slam it over extra cover. Beaten
offcutter, good length at leg stump. Poked through square leg
short and in at the corridor, carved, late, to third man
back of a length, pushed through at off stump. Cramped push to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, pushes it wide of long-on...and AB is back for the second
full at leg stump, pushed to deep square leg's left
well done. Mortaza dives low to his left at extra cover. AB had made room to drive this inside-out from leg stump
good length at off stump, pushed back past the bowler
oh gorgeous. Makes room again. It's full on middle stump. This time he tries to find the gap to sweeper's left and succeeds, with a slice
short and wide outside off stump, well timed slash, but sweeper cover cuts it off
slower bouncer. Adjusts for the lift off the pitch and taps the hook shot into the turf, in deep midwicket's direction
back of a length outside off, dabs it to third man's right and comes back for the second
good length outside off stump, leans in and drives to sweeper cover
he knows the offcutter is coming now. Good length, just outside off. And he's promptly down the track to lift this over mid-off
offcutter, short outside off stump. Backs away and looks to ramp it past the keeper. Misses. Then says to himself, audibly on the stump mic, 'oh come on, you had it!'
back of a length, fired down leg. Backs away and chops it into the covers
good length, pushed through at middle stump. Goes deep in the crease and tickles it wide of square leg
there it is. Backs away very early, makes the bowler follow him and then sends this length ball flying over the midwicket boundary with a pull
well bowled. Makes room again and this time Shakib bowls it full and wide outside off. Leaps at it to play a distinctly hockey tap. Can't beat extra cover
good length at middle stump, he's down the track but not to the pitch. Drags the slog wide of long-on
length outside off, pushed the sweeper cover
slower ball, short and in at the ribs. Controlled pull to deep square
back of a length outside off, looks to nudge to third man. Under-edges it into the pitch and can't beat keeper

dropped! Oh man. Mortaza doesn't have words left. Offcutter, full at leg stump. He gets his front leg out of the way to try and slog this over midwicket. Big top edge hangs nice and simple for Imrul Kayes at point...and it's just a completely botched attempt
yikes. It's a slower bouncer and he hangs in the crease, nice and strong base and swipes it far over the midwicket boundary
again! This bouncer is quicker. It's at his body. But once again, those hands are so so fast. Gets it over the square leg fence, much flatter than the last
slower ball, full at middle stump, steps out and adjusts to whip it to deep midwicket
sees AB back away and bowls an overpitched ball on middle. Lucky this drive isn't controlled. It rolls past his leg and long-off cleans up
full toss on the pad short stride, quick hands, launched over square leg and then he stands to see how far it's gone. And he brings up his 150
overpitched outside off...do you want to read more? Plenty of room, front leg, that big nuisance, out of the way and carved on the bounce over the extra cover boundary

oh poor Taskin. AB has done this to the best of bowlers. Taskin doesn't know where to look. Looks for the back-of-the-hand slower ball, drops it short at leg stump. AB is already loaded before it comes. He adjusts, swivels, and sends it a long way over the long leg boundary
well bowled. Looks for the yorker, gets it to tail in. Toe-ended bunt to mid-on
bouncer...looked like it was too high as AB let it go, but the umpires say it wasn't. Good end to the over for Taskin
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Swipes it along the floor to deep midwicket
superb bowling. Nails the yorker down leg side. AB does look for that shot between the legs, because he can't do anything else at that. Beaten
overpitched at off stump, goes deep in the crease and drills it flat, over mid-off and this is his highest score in ODIs

he does this to them. Figures out their variations, and makes them bowl it when he wants. Carved the full ball previously, knew the slower ball was coming. Stood tall, picked it off a length, and slogged over the midwicket boundary
full at lg stump, jammed out to deep midwicket
now Duminy! Slower ball, full at leg stump. Front leg out of the way, old-fashioned slog. Floats nicely over the midwicket fence
picks it up from outside off with a scoop. But he finds deep square. Exquisite execution. Big shuffle into the off side. But couldn't get it fine
full outside off stump, poked to mid-off
overpitched outside off, slight shape in at the batsman. Enough to throw him off the shot. Dragged with a loose grip to deep midwicket's left

holes out to deep midwicket. Attempted yorker goes wrong. But it's moving in at leg stump. He can't get under it quickly enpough. Might have been looking to go over fine leg again, with a slight shuffle. Ended up cramping himself and toe-ending this to Sabbir
full toss at leg stump, clipped straight to deep midwicket
yorker at off stump, tapped straight to point
yorker outside off stump, deep in the crease to carve it wide of sweeper cover
yorker at off stump. Squeezed out into the off side
length ball at middle stump, swipes across the line and gets an inside edge onto pad
Duminy heaves out to long-on
yorker from Rubel, dug out into the covers

leg-bye, appeal for lbw, seems to be pitching outside leg, review on the not out call. Yorker again and its struck Duminy low on the back toe. No bat detected. Pitch map shows pitching on middle and leg and struck him in line. OUT. Decision overturned.
Pretorius plays a lazy waft to long-off. Kayes take the catch just inside the rope.
tries to guide it down the leg side and does not make contact
good length, in the corridor. Half stride and he's beaten on the inside edge. Strikes him on the pads, just outside the line. Appeal is turned down
good length at  middle stump, defended into the leg side
full ball outside off stump, looks to drive on the up, big inside edge onto pad
bouncer strikes him on the left shoulder and lands wide of second slip. Climbs from a length as he looks to defend. It was angled away
good length at off stump, defended into the off side from the crease
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
good length on middle, swings away. The batsman rocks back and offers his full face, the ball goes just past it
gives the charge! Pitched up on off stump, Tamim dances down the pitch, and drives the ball through its line. Slightly in the air, as the ball goes past cover, but the fielder had no chance. Crunched
back of a length on middle and off, driven towards cover

god length on middle stump, hurries Tamim into playing the cross-batted shot towards the leg side, the batsman can't get his bat down in time and the ball raps him on the pads. Too high for any lbw appeal

back of a length on middle stump, gets behind the ball's line and gently punches the ball past mid on. It's so well timed, together with Paterson's pace, that the delivery almost goes towards cow corner for four
back of a length on middle and leg, played with soft hands off the back foot
full on middle and leg, clipped off his toes to the fine-leg fielder who is positioned slightly square. Tamim was quick to gauge the length there
full on middle and off, steps forward, getting his front foot to the line of the ball, and then drives this on the up past cover for four
back of a length on middle, moves towards the off side and defends off the back foot. The ball rolls through to Rabada
hits the deck hard, it's back of a length on middle stump, continuously rising onto the batsman. Drops his hands to negate the short-ish delivery
back of a length on leg stump, goes deep into the crease and taps the ball towards the umpire at square leg. The shot takes the pace off the delivery, thereby allowing the double
back of a length on middle and off, shoulders his arms. Quick ball, 146 kph
back of a length on the thigh, Kayes does not connect with a flick
lifter, angling across off, Tamim evades it
back of a length on middle, Tamim winds up for a big blow, and hacks it off the inside half to midwicket
chest-high short ball on the leg stump, cramps Tamim dares to hook and top-edges it fine of long leg for four
overpitched and wide outside off, Tamim slices a thick outside edge to third man
on a length and angling away outside off, Kayes shuffles across off stump and works it away to midwicket
really full on middle - near yorker swings in on middle - dug out
back of a length and width outside off, 151ks, pace like fire, Tamim scythes a cut to backward point. Duminy flings to his right to save three for his side
bouncer on the leg stump, 147.2ks, forces the batsman to duck under it
Rabada errs too full on middle, Kayes manages to chip it over mid-on
back of a length and outside off, punched away to Tahir at short third man. Another fine, tumbling stop
short on middle, fended off to midwicket off the back foot
hip-high short ball on leg stump, Tamim stylishly swats it away square of long leg

Missed chance. Andile runs back from mid-on and shells it over his shoulder. He did not even get a hand to it in the end. Tamim charges down the track. The bowler bangs it shorter on middle. Tamim sends a top edge over mid-on. Andile gets into an awkward position and makes a mess of the chance. He was too late to turn back and was never stable enough
tucked off the pads through square leg
leg-stump half-volley, Tamim punishes it to the midwicket boundary with a whip
full and straight, tucked away to the leg side
back of a length on middle, worked to the leg side again
banged in short but the direction is down leg. Wide
short and angling away outside off, 147.3ks, dabbed to backward point
back of a length on middle, worked in front of mid-on for an urgent single
full on middle and leg, flicked away straight to midwicket
full-toss on middle, attempted slower ball, bunted through square leg
short on the leg stump, tucked to fine leg
off-stump yorker, squeezed to point
gentle half-volley outside off, Kayes belts it straight of mid-off. Firm drive through the line
slower full one on middle, blocked off the front foot
full and wide outside off, the batsman throws his hands at the ball and carves a thick outside edge that rolls to third man

Pretorius wins an lbw appeal with his fourth ball! Slower, full ball from the seamer, Tamim does not spot the change-up and is struck on the flap of the back pad. Was the impact in line? The tracker might have returned umpire's call on impact
full and outside off, dabbed down to third man
tucked around the corner for one
bouncer outside off, 142ks, Liton rocks his head out of the way
full and straight, clipped away fine of long leg
good-length nip-backer, does not threaten off, left alone
off-stump yorker, dug out
141.4ks bouncer on middle, ducks under it
just short of a good length and outside off, Liton fights fire with fire. He pulls it nay tonks it flat and hard over square leg
fractionally short and outside off, Kayes is quick to swivel back and launch a pull into the grass banks beyond square leg. Back-to-back sixes for Bangladesh
good length and outside off, slower cutter, guided to point
pitched up and outside off, stretches forward and creams a drive to cover
back of a length and straight, worked to the leg side
floats one outside off, no shot
full and wide outside off, no shot again
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away to the left of midwicket
shortish and outside off, Liton slashes a back-foot cut to third man
full on middle, knocked through midwicket
leg-side wide
bouncer on middle, sails over the ducking Kayes to the keeper. Too high, and it has been called a wide
full on middle and leg, turned away to deep square leg

Liton has been pinned lbw. He chats with Kayes and challenges the on-field out decision. SA's players, however, are quite confident. Very full and slanting in on middle, raps the front pad in line with middle. Liton played all around it and missed the ball. Ultra Edge detects spike but it came from the ball hitting the pad. No inside snick involved. This would clatter into the middle stump. Bangladesh lose a review and Liton
overpitched and outside off, Mushfiq stretches out and slices a drive to sweeper cover
yorker on off, dug back down the pitch to the left of mid-on
half-volley outside off, Kayes presses forward and drives it between covers and mid-off
back of a length and angling into a back-foot defence on off
pitched up on off, driven on the up to mid-off
full on off, driven straight down the ground for one
middle-stump yorker, kept out
short and width outside off, slashed to backward point
pitched up and nibbling in close to off, well-judged leave from Mushfiq
back of a length on a fourth-stump line, punched on the up to short cover
punched to the left of short cover now for one
short on off, Kayes attempts a pull and ends up skewing it over square leg off the splice
back of a length, blocked on off stump
full and angling away outside off, run away to backward point
guided finer to third man now
full and outside off, driven through the line to deep cover off the front foot
back of a length and angling away outside off, punched wide of backward point
full and straight, clipped to deep square leg
full and outside off, driven on the up to cover
short and outside off, Mushfiq throws his bat at a cut and bottom-edges it behind to de Kock
Mushfiq hares down the track, the bowler pulls his length back outside off. Hacked away to mid-on off the inside half
short and width, cracked straight to backward point
tucked off the pads to long leg
full and swerves in, inside edged to square leg
back of a length on off, bunted to mid-on
pushed through on off, whipped away to deep midwicket
half-tracker outside leg, Mushfiq latches onto it. He rocks back and smites a pull over backward square leg
googly outside off, not much turn, defended
dabbed from outside off to point
dangled up outside off, Mushfiq stretches out, rolls his wrists, and sweeps it away to the backward square leg fence. No protection there
tossed-up legbreak, turns away, Mushfiq plays with soft hands and dabs to third man
full on the pads, picked off to deep midwicket for a single
back of a length and skids on off, Mushfiq's bat comes down at an angle. The inside edge is found and it wanders away towards midwicket
pitched up and outside off, driven languidly to mid-off for one
banged in short and outside off, pulled away to the left of deep midwicket. Tahir slides to his left and stops the ball
full around off, weak drive to mid-off
short on leg stump, top-edges a hook to fine leg
flatter legbreak, spins in on middle, pushed down to long-on
floated outside off, defended off the front foot
straight ball on middle, tapped down to long-on
low full-toss on middle, punched down to long-on
short on off, whipped away past the right of midwicket off the back foot
tossed-up legbreak, blocked to the leg side from the crease
just short of a good length and angling in towards off, Mushfiq stands tall and blocks stoutly
good length and angling in at off again, Mushfiq presses forward and skews it to mid-on off the inside half
back of a length and cuts back in at off stump, Mushfiq misjudges it and nearly chops it back onto the stumps. Too close for a cut
back of a length on middle, tucked to midwicket's right. Mushfiq takes on Bavuma's arm for a single. He is subbing for Amla
back of a length on middle, worked to midwicket
back of a length on top of off, solidly punched to cover
starts off with a loose ball down leg, directed to fine leg
length ball, angling in from around the wicket and straightens away past the outside edge. Quality delivery
back of a length and holds its line outside off, jabbed to backward point now
half-volley outside off, Kayes lays into it and creams a drive between extra cover and mid-off. Dismissive
shortish and angling in on off, worked to midwicket
pitched up and outside off, Paterson invites the drive again. Kayes obliges and strokes the ball straight to extra cover this time
short and outside off, Mushfiq stands tall and punches the ball to the left of short cover
full and angling in on off and middle, driven to short midwicket

The ball plugs in the deep again. Another batsman has been robbed of a boundary. Mushfiq shows great intent. He runs down the track and clatters it on the up over cover. The ball stops dead in the deep
nip-backer, finishes on off and cramps 'em up for room. Blocked to the leg side
full and angling into the pads, tucked away between deep square leg and fine leg
pitched up on off, drilled back down the pitch. AB moves swiftly to his right from mid-off and cuts it off
full and outside off, driven on the up, but AB is prowling at cover. He throws himself to his right and intercepts the ball
on a length and outside off, Kayes opens the face and runs it to backward point
back of a length and outside off, helped down to third man. Kayes wants two for the fifty, but Mushfiq sends him back
back of a length on off, guided to sweeper cover
Dropped by Duminy at backward point. No luck for Paterson. Short, wide outside off. Kayes cuts it in the air. Duminy dives to his left but shells it
banged in short and down the leg side, Kayes tickles a hook fine past the diving keeper and brings up his fifty
very full on off, Mushfiq can't get under it, jammed back to Tahir
slower through the air outside off, paddled down to fine leg
pushed through outside off, driven off the front foot in the gap at cover
tossed on middle, Mushfiq stays leg side of the ball and eases it through cover
high risk, high reward for Kayes. Pushed through on middle, he reverse-sweeps from the stumps, and sends the ball fine of short third man
slider on off, 90ks, bunted to midwicket
back of a length and angling into leg stump, Mushfiq directs it down to long leg
glanced off the pads to long leg again
on a length and outside off, dabbed to backward point
back of a length and wide outside off, Kayes slashes... and misses
full and wide outside off, Kayes has another crease-bound waft only to be beaten
full and angling in on middle, bunted to mid-on. They scamper across for the single
googly - breaks away outside off - Tahir reads it off the pitch and blocks to point
full on the stumps, tapped down to long-on for a single
turn and bounce! Perfectly pitched legbreak, grazes the outside edge near the higher part of the bat and rolls to short third man
Mushfiq eyes up a big reverse sweep over backward point. He ends up top-edging it over the keeper

Tahir lobs it up wide outside off, spins in, Kayes slashes away from the body and gets a thick inside edge. It is too quick for de Kock to close his gloves around the ball. Dropped, but that's a difficult chance
short and wide outside off, chopped only as far as point
full and outside off, Mushfiq steps out and drills it wide of mid-off
pitched up on off stump, Kayes sizes it up and lifts it over mid-off. Slow outfield? No problem, there was enough strength in this shot
full and shoved down leg, past the flick
full on off, nurdled wide of midwicket
back of a length and angling into a tight defence on off
banged in short and outside off, Mushfiq does not back down. He hooks and sends a top edge over the keeper's head
yorker, tails in on middle, squeezed through midwicket
full at leg stump, flicked to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, dabbed in front of midwicket from deep in the crease
back of a length, spinning into the pads. Tucked wide of short fine leg
good length at middle stump, ball climbs on him as he gets down for the sweep. Top edge lands well in front of deep backward square
back of a length at middle stump, pushed through flat and with some bounce. Watchfully pushed into the leg side
good length outside off stump, defended off the front foot
full and in at off stump, driven back down the pitch and stopped in the follow-through with his right hand
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, steps out and make room, but can't beat point with the cut
back of a length a leg stump, whipped to deep square
good length, angled across off stump. Taps it into the off side with soft hands, point swoops down on it
back of a length outside off, pushed into the leg side
short and pushed wide outside off, chopped straight to sweeper cover
yorker pushed down leg side, past the attempted sweep
clears the boundary. Good shot. Gets right under this ball at off stump and sends the sweep sailing over midwicket
good length outside off, pushed to extra cover off the front foot

back of a length ball tapped into the covers as it turns away. Quick call and takes off, but Behardien hits the non-strikers stumps direct. It's been sent upstairs....replays show he was in. That's his 27th ODI fifty
full at middle stump, flicked straight to midwicket

simple catch to de Villiers at extra cover. Or not, based on his reaction. Looks like he lost the ball in the crowd, but it was that soft. Didn't make a difference. A googly from Tahir, good length at off stump. He doesn't pick it and looks to flick again. Leading edge carries at knee height and there's loud roar from Tahir
back of a length at off stump, tapped straight to point
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on from the crease
back of a length, dipping in at middle stump. Tapped on the up to long-on
offcutter, back of a length and way outside leg stump. Doesn't cut back enough to make contact with anything
back of a length in the corridor, hurriedly poked to extra cover
good length at leg stump, steps out and skews this past midwicket off the inside half of the bat
short ball outside off, goes across the line and gets under the pull shot. But it doesn't carry to deep square
good length outside off, backs away and drives through extra cover...where de Villiers can't get to it. Rabada fumbles at long-off
short and just outside off, backs away to cut it past point

edged and brilliantly taken by de Kock. A slider from Tahir, outside off stump. The keeper doesn't seem to have picked it. His first step is towards the leg side. The batsman, on the other hand, seems to know it's going across him. Even then, it's a poor shot with a slip in place - he's looking to run it off the outer half. De Kock gets his hands in the right place and takes the edge. Shakib walks
slider, back of a length at off stump. Defended off the back foot
googly, short and wide outside off. Plenty of time to tap this to cover point
googly, full and outside off. Stretches forward to defend into the covers

oh dear. Rabada lets it through. Dismal fielding from the fast bowler. Short one at off stump. Steps out, makes room and ramps this wide of third man. He gets across, and is slow to get down on it to negate the poor bounce on this outfield
back of a length outside off stump, slapped to sweeper cover
offcutter, good length and down leg side
back of a length at off stump, dabs it to third man
slower ball, full at middle stump. Clipped wide of mid-on with soft hands
offcutter, back of a length outside off. Run down to third man
back of a length at off stump. Tapped back down the pitch
back of a length outside off, stabs at it with no feet, straight to point
close. Back of a length ball tails in at middle stump line. He heaves across the line and can't get bat on it. It flies over the stumps
back of a length at middle stump, hurriedly squeezed out to deep square
back of a length outside off stump, run down to third man off the outside half
yorker just outside off stump, barely dug out into the off side
back of a length into the pads, tickled to fine leg's right
slices it straight to point. Offcutter dug in very short outside off. He steps out and gets a fair distance away from it. Has to reach out in the end with a cut and he can't clear Duminy
full at off stump, driven straight to mid-off
back of a length outside off, nips back in a tad and beats the inside edge as he looks to guide it past short third man
back of a length at off stump, tapped to midwicket on the up
slower ball, back of a length at off stump. Very early on the pull. Thick inside edge to fine leg's right
full and angled in at the pads, defended to midwicket
back of a length outside off, shovelled on the up to sweeper cover
bouncer outside off stump, jumps into the leg side and pokes away from his body. Beaten
back of a length and climbing in the corridor, inside edge onto pad as he fends away from the body
back of a length at off stump, legcutter puts him off as he looks to turn it into the leg side. Lands pitch side on the off
bouncer starts at a middle stump line and climbs over his shoulder before he can react to it
yorker at middle stump, 145kph, squeezed through midwicket
slower bouncer outside off, pulled into the floor, straight to midwicket
good length in the corridor, pushed to point with an open face
good length at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
slower bouncer outside off, backs away and slashes, can't get bat on it
back of a length outside off, sits in the pitch, he closes the face too early on the flick and can't get it away
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length outside off stump, punched to long-off
good length, angled into leg stump. Flicked to deep square leg
good length, tossed up at off stump. Big stride as he drives to long-off
googly, tossed up outside off. Steps out but can't make it to the pitch. Drags it wide of long-on
slider, good length on middle stump. Defended off the back foot
full at leg stump, tapped to long-on
good length at middle stump, steps out, mistimes the swipe to long-on
slower ball, short at middle stump. Waits for it and nails the hook, but can't beat fine leg to his left
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Shapes to cut, lets it go. That was marginal - could have been called wide
short ball, slow and in the corridor. Guides it towards short third...where Tahir runs to his left and then sticks out his right hand above his head to stop it after a bad bounce
length at off stump, dabbed into the off side with soft hands
shot. Slower ball, short and sits up nicely outside off. Gets leg side of it and clatters it to the extra cover boundary
tossed up at middle stump, makes room and defends into the off side
good length outside off, feebly pushed to cover point
full at leg stump, pushed in front of deep midwicket with soft hands
slider in the corridor, punched to cover off the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven firmly to long-off
quicker one, spins away rapidly outside off stump as he looks to cut. Beaten

back of a length and down leg side. Looks to pull, but it deflects to short third man off the pads. He shies at the on-strikers end, where the batsman is trying to make his crease. Can't hit the stumps
short one at off stump, pulled to deep square
good length at off stump, gets the front leg away and punches it hard past the bowler who couldn't get a hand to it
slower ball, short and just outside off stump. Ramps it upppishly and it lands between backward point and short third man, who have a bit of a mix-up and don't go for the catch
low full toss down leg side, tucked past short fine leg with ease
slower ball, short at off stump, pulled to deep square
googly, length at off stump. Looks to sweep, bat turns in his hand and he swipes it to long leg

'mine mine mine' says Faf at extra cover before taking a simple catch. Tossed up wide outside off. He goes down the track and looks to play the slog sweep. Gets a top edge that doesn't travel too wide
googly, tossed up outside off. Driven straight to extra cover
slider, back of a length at off stump. Jammed into the pitch off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended pitch side off the front foot
yorker length outside off stump, driven to mid-off

good length, slanted in at off stump. Bat and pad very close together. It looks like a well executed forward defence but De Kock is convinced it's pad first...appeal turned down. They've reviewed. Replays suggest it was pad first but the impact is outside. Not out. Review lost.
good length in the corridor, angled bat bunt, under-edged to the keeper
back of a length in the corridor, gets the pull high on the bat, it dribbles past the non-striker
full and in at middle stump. Inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick
slower bouncer in the corridor, checks the pull shot. Lobs it in deep square's direction
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
good length wide outside off, poked to sweeper cover off the front foot
good length at middle stump, defended to midwicket
slower ball dropped short outisde off, cut to sweeper cover's left
full and in at leg stump, gets the bat down late and the inside edge races to the fine leg fence
slower ball, full outside off stump. Steps out and reaches out to slice it over point
yorker on the toes, clipped on the full to deep square
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Punched wide of extra cover where Faf misfields, but sweeper was backing up
clean bowled. Goes wide of the crease and zips this in from outside off, back of a length. Smashes into the leg stump at about knee height as he looks to whip this off the back foot
good length, angled in at middle stump. Inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick
overpitched outside off, looks to drive, but he's late on it. Beaten
plumb in front. He's skiddy, this guy, and very deceptive. Length ball comes back in quickly from outside off. He looks to flick it on angle but is trapped right in front of middle
full and angled down leg side. Bit of reverse there, but it's a wide
traps him on the front pad as he looks to flick from the crease. Big appeal. Looks close, but it was going down
full and angled into the pads, inside edge onto pad as he flicks
yorker at middle stump, jammed out to long-on
full and fired down leg side
full at middle stump, defended into the off side with no feet
back of a length in the corridor, defended to point off the back foot
good length at middle stump, turns it down to fine lg off the inside edge
back of a length at leg stump, front leg across the body as he whips to deep square
pops the middle stump. Good length ball, angled in from outside off. No feet, swings across the line and misses comprehensively
back of a length outside off, stabs at it, gets an inside edge that lands behind the stumps
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length at off stump, pokes away from the body, back down the pitch
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
full at off stump, gets the front leg out of the way and drives to mid-off
back of a length, angled across off stump. Dabbed to third man
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
short ball at a leg stump line. Makes room to play the pull, but it's too quick for him
yorker at leg stump, backs away and plonks the bat down. Inside edge to the fine leg boundary
full at off stump, backs away and drives to extra cover
yorker at off stump, backs away and keeps it out
full and angled in at off stump from around the wicket, squeezed to deep square off the inside edge
slower ball, full and wide outside off. Backs away and tries to slice it. Beaten
back of a length at leg stump, flicked on the up to midwicket
shot. Slower ball, short and on middle stump. Backs away and clubs it wide of mid-on
that's it. A full, fast one at leg stump and he gets a wicket on a very average bowling day for him. Too much for Rubel
